skill.name: code-review
skill.description: Battle-tested code review practices optimizing for codebase health and team velocity
skill.summary: Battle-tested code review practices optimizing for codebase health and team velocity
skill.author: Claude Assistant

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance files. Static scanner incorrectly flagged example shell commands and security terminology in documentation as code execution threats. All 448 findings are FALSE POSITIVES - no executable code, no network access, no filesystem operations. This skill is a knowledge base only.

content.user_title: Improve code review quality and velocity
content.value_statement: Code review practices vary widely between teams, causing inconsistent feedback, slow turnaround, and friction. This skill provides battle-tested workflows, checklists, and classification systems that help teams review faster while catching more issues.
actual_capabilities: Guides authors through pre-PR checklist including tests, lint, and self-review
Implements two-pass review methodology (design first, then implementation)
Provides comment classification system (critical, issue, suggestion, nit, question, praise)
Generates PR templates and CODEOWNERS files for team adoption
Tracks review metrics and SLA compliance for teams
Integrates with existing Claude Code review commands like /review-security
limitations: Does not execute code or access user files directly
Requires integration with existing Claude Code review commands
Does not provide automated security scanning beyond guidance
Team metrics require manual tracking or additional tooling

use_cases.title: Review your own PR
use_cases.description: Use author checklist before opening PR to catch issues early

use_cases.title: Conduct thorough reviews
use_cases.description: Follow two-pass methodology to review PRs efficiently in under 30 minutes

use_cases.title: Establish team standards
use_cases.description: Generate PR templates and CODEOWNERS files, set SLAs, track metrics

prompt_templates.title: Pre-PR checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the author checklist on my changes. Check that tests pass, lint is clean, and the PR description is complete.

prompt_templates.title: Quick review request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this PR using the two-pass methodology. Focus on design first, then implementation details.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a detailed review of this PR. Check logic correctness, edge cases, error handling, and test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Security assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: This PR touches authentication. Run a security review focusing on authorization checks and input validation.

output_examples.input: Run the author checklist on my changes
output: All tests pass locally
No linting errors
TypeScript compiles cleanly
No debug code found
Self-review completed
PR size: 247 lines (under 400 target)
Context section explains why changes are needed
Test plan provided with edge cases
Ready to open PR

output_examples.input: Review this PR that modifies authentication code
output: Pass 1 (Design): Approach is sound, auth flow is correct
Pass 2 (Implementation): Logic handles edge cases properly
Critical: Missing authorization check on line 45
Issue: Error messages reveal too much information
Suggestion: Consider using parameterized queries
Praise: Excellent test coverage for auth flows

output_examples.input: Help our team improve code review turnaround
output: Recommended SLAs: First response under 24 hours
Size policy: Target under 400 lines per PR
Generated PR template with required sections
Generated CODEOWNERS file for auto-assignment
Metrics to track: Review latency, PR size, SLA compliance

best_practices: Run the author checklist before every PR to catch issues early
Use two-pass review methodology to stay within 30-minute time budget
Classify every comment with the appropriate prefix to set expectations
anti_patterns: Monster PRs (over 800 lines) that cannot be reviewed effectively
Rubber stamp approvals without actually reading the changes
Blocking merge on cosmetic nitpicks instead of using automated formatting

faq.question: Does this skill work with any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes. The methodology is language-agnostic. Templates can be customized for any codebase.

faq.question: Which Claude Code commands does it integrate with?
How large of a PR can be reviewed effectively?
faq.answer: Target under 400 lines. Effectiveness drops significantly beyond 800 lines. Consider splitting large PRs.

faq.question: Does this skill work with GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket?
faq.answer: Yes. Templates and workflows work with any git hosting. Adjust team-specific settings as needed.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: No data is collected or stored. All processing happens locally within your Claude Code session.

faq.question: Can I automate the checklist in CI?
faq.answer: Partially. The methodology is designed for human reviewers. Some checks like tests and lint run in CI automatically.
